title: DEV mode fails when using classified dependencies
body:
### Describe the bug

My project uses a maven dependency (jar) that has a <classifier>. The project compiles, tests, and executes just fine. But the Quarkus DEV mode fails to start because of an exception while assembling the project.

### Expected behavior

Quarkus DEV mode should work as expected even if some dependencies use a classifier to select the proper jar.

### Actual behavior

"mvn clean quarkus:dev -X" leads to the following error:

```
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.7.5.Final:dev (default-cli) on project classifier-test: Failed to run
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute (MojoExecutor.java:215)

    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.builder.singlethreaded.SingleThreadedBuilder.build (SingleThreadedBuilder.java:56)
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleStarter.execute (LifecycleStarter.java:128)

    at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.launch (Launcher.java:225)
    at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.mainWithExitCode (Launcher.java:406)
    at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.main (Launcher.java:347)
Caused by: org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoFailureException: Failed to run

    at org.apache.maven.DefaultMaven.doExecute (DefaultMaven.java:305)

    at io.quarkus.maven.DevMojo.addProject (DevMojo.java:703)

    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.builder.singlethreaded.SingleThreadedBuilder.build (SingleThreadedBuilder.java:56)

    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Method.java:566)
    at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.launchEnhanced (Launcher.java:282)
    at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.launch (Launcher.java:225)
    at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.mainWithExitCode (Launcher.java:406)
    at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.main (Launcher.java:347)
```

### How to Reproduce?

The attached project is a maven wrapper project with two children:
- a small library which contains an injectable CDI bean. This project uses a classifier for the produced Jar.
- a Quarkus application with a greeting resource, that uses the (classified) JAR as a dependency.

1. Build the whole project with `mvn clean install`
The library and the quarkus app will build just fine. The Quarkus tests are executed successfully, injecting the bean from the qualified jar and returning the proper response.

2. Now try to start dev mode using `mvn quarkus:dev -f qualifier-test`
The application will not start. Instead an exception from the quarkus plugin in thrown.

[classifier.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/8399277/classifier.zip)


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Mac OS 12.3 

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.14" 2022-01-18 LTS

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.7.5

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Maven 3.8.4

### Additional information

Explanation, why we are using qualifiers:
In the real world, we have a support library that provides a couple of common Quarkus features to our microservices. In order to ensure full compatibility (and because our services don't all use the same Quarkus version), we compile this library multiple times using different Quarkus versions, putting the used Quarkus version as the qualifier.
So module A will use the library with qualifier <2.7.5.Final> to fetch the version of the library compiled against Quarkus 2.7.5.Final, while module B will use the version with qualifier <2.7.4.Final> because it still uses Quarkus 2.7.4
